block.p: They look a little like elephants and mice, but the world's wealthiest nations have put pressure on some of the smallest to stop offering shelter to tax dodgers and money launderers. For the first time the developed nations published a blacklist of 35 tax havens and 15 potential laundering centers, many of them Atlantic and Pacific island getaways, and told them to clean up their banks or face sanctions.
